roleset.name: lead, escort
roleset.note: USHER-V NOTES: Member of Vncls captain-29.8-1. (from usher.02-v)

example.name: would not have expected this usage
example.text: [Visitors]-1 are ushered *trace*-1 into the premises by red-frocked doormen known as waiters, a reminder of the insurance market's origins in a coffeehouse in 17th century London.
example.arg: by red-frocked doormen known as waiters

example.name: Ushering an event
example.text: I ushered the play on Saturday and I had a REALLY good time.

example.name: with source
example.text: That's the curious consequence of a daring experiment in form so successfully executed: it ushered the play from radical to canonical.

example.name: so that's when it started
example.text: But in the three leading political contests of 1989, the negative ads have reached new levels of hostility, raising fears that this kind of mudslinging, empty of significant issues, is ushering in a new era of campaigns without content.
example.arg: this kind of mudslinging, empty of significant issues,
a new era of campaigns without content
